topic.title: My Youtube & KopyKate Channel on Zeronet
topic.body:
My Youtube Channel on Zeronet:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/149EPBN4hQRpwj5TcoPETepnoXHCUXzaCN/?Channel=defalt@zeroid.bit

My KopyKate Channel:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/big.kopykate.bit/?Channel=defalt@zeroid.bit

1512483351_1u6V1rj2KzNCnVs6MooZRoJDZ6fPg.body:
I didn't know Kopykate until you mentioned it.
If Youtube and Kopykate don't have any difference, it's actually useless to have two.
I like Youtube because it has a name that indicates the purpose of the site. The name Kopykate is less meaningful for people who don't know the site yet. But Kopykate seems to be the original site.

1512266574_19sggoAZ4hcorrrfWoFWP9rwfpVsL.body:
> [kopyjane](#comment_89_17ffrcHNzbFoUe81PyMEagQdv2DGNRLFcE): The problem with search engines on ZeroNet right now is that they rely almost entirely on human input in order to build up a proper database. You don't have the luxury of using web crawlers in order to search for content, because content needs to be downloaded onto a disk in order to be read, including databases.. unless you're using a ZeroNet proxy. They also tend to be biased toward sites that the creator likes. I suppose the only way to beat this problem would be to create a ZeroNet python plugin (call it CrawlerBot) that automatically queries every single .db file of every single zite you've downloaded simply looking for links with http://127.0.0.1:43110/* It would then update that database universally across all ZeroNet clients, and could be queried by any zite. Duplicates are simply ignored, but new links are added.

It's a good idea. I'll see how I can do this. Thanks :)
